Ship Performance Visualization

Author

Xiaohan Zhang

Published

February 16-2025

Modified

last-modified

# Install and load required packages
pacman::p_load(ggplot2, tidyverse)

# Load libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(scales)
library(ggridges)
# Load the dataset
ship_data <- read_csv("data/Ship_Performance_Dataset.csv")

# Glimpse of the dataset
glimpse(ship_data)
Rows: 2,736
Columns: 18

$ Ship_Type               <chr> "Container Ship", "Fish Carrier", "Container S…
$ Route_Type              <chr> "None", "Short-haul", "Long-haul", "Transocean…
$ Engine_Type             <chr> "Heavy Fuel Oil (HFO)", "Steam Turbine", "Dies…
$ Maintenance_Status      <chr> "Critical", "Good", "Fair", "Fair", "Fair", "F…
$ Speed_Over_Ground_knots <dbl> 12.59756, 10.38758, 20.74975, 21.05510, 13.742…
$ Engine_Power_kW         <dbl> 2062.9840, 1796.0574, 1648.5567, 915.2618, 108…
$ Distance_Traveled_nm    <dbl> 1030.9436, 1060.4864, 658.8741, 1126.8225, 144…
$ Draft_meters            <dbl> 14.132284, 14.653083, 7.199261, 11.789063, 9.7…

$ Efficiency_nm_per_kWh   <dbl> 1.4551789, 0.2903614, 0.4995945, 0.7029057, 1.…
$ Seasonal_Impact_Score   <dbl> 1.4156533, 0.8856478, 1.4058132, 1.3707043, 0.…

# Data quality checks
# Check for missing values
if (any(is.na(ship_data))) {
  print("There are missing values in the data")
} else {
  print("There are no missing values")
}
[1] "There are no missing values"
# Check for duplicate values
if (any(duplicated(ship_data))) {
  print("There are duplicate values in the data")
} else {
  print("There are no duplicate values")
}
[1] "There are no duplicate values"
# Outlier detection
# Identify numeric columns and compute Z-Scores
numeric_columns <- ship_data %>% select(where(is.numeric)) %>% names()
z_scores <- ship_data %>% select(all_of(numeric_columns)) %>% scale() %>% as.data.frame()

# Detect Outliers
outliers <- data.frame()

for (i in 1:length(numeric_columns)) {
  column_name <- numeric_columns[i]
  column_z_scores <- z_scores[, i]
  
  # Identify outliers based on Z-scores
  outlier_indices <- which(abs(column_z_scores) > 3)
  
  if (length(outlier_indices) > 0) {
    outliers <- rbind(outliers, 
                     data.frame(
                       Column = column_name,
                       Row_Index = outlier_indices,
                       Z_Score = column_z_scores[outlier_indices],
                       Value = ship_data[[column_name]][outlier_indices]
                     ))
  }
}

# Output outliers detected
if (nrow(outliers) > 0) {
  print("Outliers Detected:")
  print(outliers %>% arrange(Column, desc(abs(Z_Score))) %>% group_by(Column) %>% slice_head(n = 5))
} else {
  print("No Outliers Detected")
}
[1] "No Outliers Detected"
# Data cleaning and preparation
ship_data_clean <- ship_data %>%
  mutate(
    Year = year(Date),
    Month = month(Date),
    YearMonth = format(Date, "%Y-%m"),
    # Handle "None" values
    across(where(is.character), ~na_if(., "None")),
    Profit_USD = Revenue_per_Voyage_USD - Operational_Cost_USD
  ) %>%
  filter(complete.cases(.))  # Remove rows with NA values

# Adding the Profit_Status column and converting it to a factor
ship_data_clean <- ship_data_clean %>%
  mutate(Profit_Status = ifelse(Profit_USD >= 0, "Profitable", "Loss")) %>%
  mutate(Profit_Status = as.factor(Profit_Status))
# Time Series Analysis
time_analysis <- ship_data_clean %>%
  group_by(YearMonth) %>%
  summarise(
    Average_Revenue = mean(Revenue_per_Voyage_USD, na.rm = TRUE),
    Average_Cost = mean(Operational_Cost_USD, na.rm = TRUE),
    Voyage_Count = n()
  ) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = c(Average_Revenue, Average_Cost),
               names_to = "Metric",
               values_to = "Amount")

# Revenue and Cost Trend Plot
ggplot(time_analysis, aes(x = YearMonth, y = Amount, color = Metric, group = Metric)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), legend.position = "top") +
  labs(title = "Trends of Revenue and Cost Over Time", x = "Year-Month", y = "Amount (USD)")
# Profit/Loss Analysis by Ship Type
ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Ship_Type, fill = Profit_Status)) +
  geom_bar(position = "fill") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Profitable" = "#2ecc71", "Loss" = "#e74c3c")) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Profit/Loss Ratio by Ship Type", x = "Ship Type", y = "Proportion", fill = "Profit Status") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format())
# Profit Distribution by Ship Type
ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Ship_Type, y = Profit_USD, fill = Profit_Status)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Profitable" = "#2ecc71", "Loss" = "#e74c3c")) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Profit Distribution by Ship Type", x = "Ship Type", y = "Profit (USD)", fill = "Profit Status") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format())
# Engine Type Analysis
ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Engine_Type, y = Profit_USD, fill = Profit_Status)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Profitable" = "#2ecc71", "Loss" = "#e74c3c")) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Profit Distribution by Engine Type", x = "Engine Type", y = "Profit (USD)", fill = "Profit Status") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format())
# Route Type Analysis
ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Route_Type, y = Profit_USD, fill = Profit_Status)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Profitable" = "#2ecc71", "Loss" = "#e74c3c")) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Profit Distribution by Route Type", x = "Route Type", y = "Profit (USD)", fill = "Profit Status") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format())
# Efficiency Analysis
ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Efficiency_nm_per_kWh, y = Profit_USD)) +
  geom_density_2d_filled() +
  geom_smooth(color = "red", se = TRUE) +
  facet_wrap(~Ship_Type) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linetype = "dashed", color = "white") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Efficiency vs Profit Density by Ship Type", x = "Efficiency (nm/kWh)", y = "Profit (USD)") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format())
# Maintenance Status Analysis
ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Maintenance_Status, y = Profit_USD, fill = Profit_Status)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Profitable" = "#2ecc71", "Loss" = "#e74c3c")) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Profit Distribution by Maintenance Status", x = "Maintenance Status", y = "Profit (USD)", fill = "Profit Status") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format())
# Top Combinations Analysis
# Top 15 Combinations with Average Profit
top_combinations <- ship_data_clean %>%
  filter(!is.na(Ship_Type), !is.na(Engine_Type), !is.na(Route_Type), !is.na(Maintenance_Status), !is.na(Profit_USD)) %>%
  group_by(Ship_Type, Engine_Type, Route_Type, Maintenance_Status) %>%
  summarise(mean_profit = mean(Profit_USD, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  arrange(desc(mean_profit)) %>%
  head(15)

ggplot(top_combinations, aes(y = reorder(paste(Ship_Type, Engine_Type, Route_Type, Maintenance_Status), mean_profit), 
                             x = mean_profit, fill = mean_profit)) +
  geom_col() +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "blue", high = "red") +
  labs(title = "Top 15 Combinations with Average Profit", y = "Combination", x = "Average Profit (USD)", fill = "Average Profit") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 0, hjust = 1))
# Monthly Profit Trends
ship_data_clean %>%
  group_by(YearMonth, Ship_Type) %>%
  summarise(avg_profit = mean(Profit_USD)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = YearMonth, y = avg_profit, color = Ship_Type, group = Ship_Type)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Average Monthly Profit Trends by Ship Type", x = "Year-Month", y = "Average Profit (USD)") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format())
# Combination Elements Frequency Analysis
top_combinations_freq <- top_combinations %>%
  gather(key = "Variable", value = "Value", Ship_Type, Engine_Type, Route_Type, Maintenance_Status) %>%
  count(Variable, Value) %>%
  arrange(desc(n))

ggplot(top_combinations_freq, aes(x = reorder(Value, n), y = n, fill = n)) +
  geom_col() +
  facet_wrap(~ Variable, scales = "free_x", ncol = 2) +
  scale_fill_gradient(low = "blue", high = "red") +
  labs(title = "Frequency of Elements in Top 15 Combinations", x = "Element", y = "Frequency", fill = "Frequency") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
# Distribution Analysis
library(gridExtra)

# Maintenance Status Distribution
p1 <- ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Maintenance_Status)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "skyblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Maintenance Status Distribution", x = "Maintenance Status", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()

# Engine Type Distribution
p2 <- ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Engine_Type)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "lightgreen", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Engine Type Distribution", x = "Engine Type", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()

# Ship Type Distribution
p3 <- ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Ship_Type)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "lightcoral", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Ship Type Distribution", x = "Ship Type", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()

# Route Type Distribution
p4 <- ggplot(ship_data_clean, aes(x = Route_Type)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "lightskyblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Route Type Distribution", x = "Route Type", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()

# Combine all plots
grid.arrange(p1, p2, p3, p4, ncol = 2)

Standardized Frequency Analysis

Calculate standardized frequencies

top_combinations <- ship_data_clean %>% filter(!is.na(Ship_Type), !is.na(Engine_Type), !is.na(Route_Type), !is.na(Maintenance_Status), !is.na(Profit_USD)) %>% group_by(Ship_Type, Engine_Type, Route_Type, Maintenance_Status) %>% summarise( mean_profit = mean(Profit_USD, na.rm = TRUE), freq = n(), .groups = “drop” ) %>% arrange(desc(mean_profit)) %>% mutate( freq_std = (freq - mean(freq)) / sd(freq) )

Get top 15 after standardization

top_15_after <- top_combinations %>% arrange(desc(freq_std)) %>% head(15)

Prepare data for visualization

top_combinations_freq_after <- top_15_after %>% gather(key = “Variable”, value = “Value”, Ship_Type, Engine_Type, Route_Type, Maintenance_Status) %>% group_by(Variable, Value) %>% summarise(n = n(), .groups = “drop”) %>% ungroup() %>% mutate(n = case_when( Variable == “Ship_Type” ~ top_15_after\(freq_std[match(Value, top_15_after\)Ship_Type)], Variable == “Engine_Type” ~ top_15_after\(freq_std[match(Value, top_15_after\)Engine_Type)], Variable == “Route_Type” ~ top_15_after\(freq_std[match(Value, top_15_after\)Route_Type)], Variable == “Maintenance_Status” ~ top_15_after\(freq_std[match(Value, top_15_after\)Maintenance_Status)], TRUE ~ NA_real_ ))

Visualize standardized frequencies

ggplot(top_combinations_freq_after, aes(x = reorder(Value, n), y = n, fill = n)) + geom_col() + facet_wrap(~ Variable, scales = “free_x”, ncol = 2) + scale_fill_gradient(low = “blue”, high = “red”) + labs(title = “Standardized Frequency of Elements in Top 15 Combinations”, x = “Element”, y = “Standardized Frequency”, fill = “Standardized Frequency”) + theme_minimal() + theme(axis.text.x = element
